person.content:
Please identify the "Person" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: K.J. Matthew said at the Asia Rubber Markets meeting here Indian production of natural rubber in 1996/97 will reach 547,000 tonnes against projected demand of 578,000 tonnes , a gap of 31,000 tonnes .

Let's think step by step.

1. K.J. Matthew: He is the person who made the statement.
2. Asia Rubber Markets: It is the location of the meeting.
3. Indian production: It is the subject of the statement, referring to the amount of natural rubber produced in India.
4. 1996/97: It is the time period for the Indian production mentioned.
5. 547,000 tonnes: It is the amount of Indian production of natural rubber.
6. Projected demand: It is the expected demand for natural rubber.
7. 578,000 tonnes: It is the projected demand for natural rubber.
8. a gap of 31,000 tonnes: It is the difference between the projected demand and the actual production.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Person.

1. K.J. Matthew
2. K.J. Matthew (implied)

The other entities in the paragraph do not clearly refer to persons. They either refer to things (Indian production, 1996/97, 547,000 tonnes, projected demand, 578,000 tonnes, a gap of 31,000 tonnes) or locations (Asia Rubber Markets).

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Person".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.
